Crimes.Crime_Name: Serious non-political crime under Article 1F(b) of the United Nations Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether Nwobi's cocaine trafficking conviction constitutes a serious non-political crime under Article 1F(b)
Crimes.Governing_Law: Article 1F(b) of the UN Refugee Convention, Section 98 of IRPA
Crimes.Application_Facts: Nwobi convicted of cocaine trafficking in Germany; Board failed to consider mosque arson
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Federal Court set aside Board’s decision and referred for redetermination
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Board made legal errors in assessing seriousness and failed to consider all exclusion grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Convicted of drug trafficking and participated in burning a mosque
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Serious non-political crime exclusion under Article 1F(b)
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Presumption of seriousness for crimes punishable by 10+ years, rebuttable by mitigating factors
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature of offense, potential punishment, mitigating circumstances
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, Controlled Drugs and Substances Act
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Board misinterpreted Canadian law and considered extraneous sentencing information
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Conviction record, details of mosque burning
Crimes.Application_Basis: Conviction in Germany for cocaine trafficking
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Drug conviction, failure to assess mosque arson
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Denial of refugee status based on Article 1F(b) exclusion
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Article 1F(b) excludes individuals with serious non-political crimes
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider mosque arson as potential serious crime
Crimes.Outcome: Decision set aside, remanded for new hearing
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential danger to community due to serious criminal conduct
Crimes.Cause_Description: Nwobi claimed refugee status after drug conviction and involvement in arson
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to independently assess all exclusion grounds
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Application of Canadian law to foreign conviction
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient consideration of all criminal acts
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Legal error in interpreting drug offense severity and omission of arson analysis
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to examine all relevant criminal behavior
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Presumption of seriousness under Canadian jurisprudence

Crimes.Crime_Name: Possession of cocaine for the purpose of trafficking
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Refugee eligibility based on criminal inadmissibility
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether possession of cocaine for trafficking is a serious non-political crime
Crimes.Governing_Law: Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, Article 1F(b) of Refugee Convention
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of Refugee Protection Division decision
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board incorrectly assessed German conviction under Canadian sentencing framework
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the Minister to establish seriousness under Article 1F(b)
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Crimes punishable by 10+ years are presumed serious
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Board failed to apply correct legal framework
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of cocaine trafficking conviction in Germany
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration and drug laws applied to foreign conviction
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Claimed refugee protection despite criminal conviction
Crimes.Court_Result: Decision set aside, case referred back
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Controlled Drugs and Substances Act, IRPA
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Sought refugee protection, did not dispute conviction
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to overturn favorable refugee decision
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board, Federal Court
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Presumption of seriousness for drug trafficking

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Exclusion from refugee protection based on serious criminal act
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High – intentional destruction of religious property
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Adequate but not analyzed by Board
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Board failed to evaluate relevance or truth
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Potential threat to public order and safety
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Seriousness assessed on balance of probabilities
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board failed to consider arson as exclusion ground
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Not applicable – foreign act, no formal sentence
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Board’s duty to consider all exclusion grounds sua sponte
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
